Others: The Celtics were without injured leading scorer De'Aaron Fox for the Kings.
Domantas Sabonis had a herculean rebounding performance with 28 boards, the most by a Celtics opponent since Ben Wallace in March 2002.
Sacramento Kings outscored Boston by 17 points in the fourth quarter to win 114-97.
Jaylen Brown led all Celtics scorers with 28 points, with Kristaps Porzingis adding 22 and 10 rebounds.
The Celtics shot 26.8% from three as a team and had 15 turnovers.
The Celtics will look to bounce back against the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday.
